alert.note: Alert for Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Crook County through 415 PM MDT... At 338 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of Alzada, or 39 miles northwest of Sundance, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Crook County, east of Lightning Flat. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern Wyoming. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
